metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

abstract.gco:CharacterString: Statewide coverage of 1940 American Indian Reservations. Boundaries that cross into the adjacent states are included. Population data is from the Annual Report of the Commissioner of Indian Affairs

purpose.gco:CharacterString: To use in GIS systems for historical study and analysis This datasets is made available to interested persons through the University of Arizona's instance of Open Geoportal. It has been provided to assist educators, students, researchers, and policy makers in mapping and/or analysis applications.

credit.gco:CharacterString: Chris Kollen, University of Arizona Library

title.gco:CharacterString: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Digitized reservation boundaries from the following maps: Ak-Chin and Gila River used Highway system map, Pima Indian Agency, Arizona: Gila River Indian Reservation and Maricopa (Ak Chin) Indian Reservation, 1971; Camp Verde used Highway system map, Truxton Canon Indian Agency, Arizona: Camp Verde Indian Reservation, 1971 (could not find any maps prior to 1970 although according to Tiller the reservation was created in 1910 and additions were made in 1915 and 1917); Cocopah used Highway system map, Colorado River Indian Agency, Arizona: Cocopah Indian Reservation, 1972; Colorado River Indian Reservation used Colorado River Indian Agency, highway system map, 1971 and 1990 American Indian Areas online file; Fort Apache, Fort Yuma-Quechan and San Xavier used 1990 American Indian Areas online file; Fort Mohave used Highway system map, Colorado River Indian Agency, Arizona: Fort Mojave Indian Reservation, 1972; Gila Bend used Surface management responsibility, State of Arizona, 1979; Havasupai used Highway system map, Truxton Canon Indian Agency, Arizona: Hualapai Indian Reservation and Havasupai Indian Reservation, 1971; Hopi used Map of the Indian Country in Arizona, New Mexico, Utah & Colorado, 1961; Hualapai used Map of Haulpai Indian Reservation, Arizona, 1941; Kaibab Paiute used Highway system map, Hopi Indian Agency, Arizona (Kaibab Indian Reservation), 1971; Navajo used Arizona, 1939 and as a guide Navajo atlas : environments, resources, people, and history of the Din,e; Bikeyah; Salt River and Fort McDowell used Highway system map, Salt River Indian Agency, Arizona: Fort McDowell Indian Reservation and Salt River Indian Reservation, 1971; San Carlos used National atlas: Arizona and New Mexico, 1973; Tohono O'odham used State of Arizona, 1939; and Yavapai-Prescott used Prescott 15' topographic quadrangle, 1948. Also used Tiller's guide to Indian country: economic profiles of American Indian reservations for dates on boundary changes.

description.gco:CharacterString: Dataset renamed from 1940_reservations.shp to Arizona_AmerIndianReservations_1940.shp by Ben Hickson with the University of Arizona Library. Metadata fields corresponding the Open Geoportal Working Group Best Practices Guide (http://opengeoportal.org/working-groups/metadata/) were also updated.
